title: Instant Pot Filipino Chicken Adobo Recipe
description: This Instant Pot chicken adobo is cooked with sweet and savory vinegar-soy sauce, then finished under a broiler without having to marinate for hours.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Global Cuisines Asian Filipino Instant Pot Filipino Chicken Adobo 4.8 (31) 30 Reviews 11 Photos This Instant Pot chicken adobo has all the Filipino flavor you love without hours of marinating. Serve over rice, if desired. Submitted by Soup Loving Nicole Updated on June 22, 2023 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 11 11 11 11 Prep Time: 5 mins Cook Time: 30 mins Additional Time: 5 mins Total Time: 40 mins Servings: 4 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 4 servings ½ cup distilled white vinegar ¼ cup soy sauce 2 tablespoons minced garlic 1 tablespoon olive oil 1 tablespoon brown sugar 1 teaspoon black peppercorns, roughly cracked 2 bay leaves 1 large onion, sliced 1 ½ pounds bone-in, skin-on chicken thighs 1 tablespoon chopped scallions Directions Whisk together vinegar, soy sauce, garlic, olive oil, brown sugar, and crushed peppercorns in a medium bowl until sugar is dissolved. Stir in bay leaves. Line the bottom of a multi-functional pressure cooker (such as Instant Pot) with onion slices. Place chicken thighs over onion and pour vinegar mixture over the top. Close and lock the lid. Select high pressure according to manufacturer's instructions; set the timer for 10 minutes. Allow 10 minutes for pressure to build. Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil. Release pressure using the quick-release method according to manufacturer's instructions, about 5 minutes. Unlock and remove the lid. Using tongs, transfer chicken thighs to the prepared baking sheet, skin-side up. Select Sauté function and cook until sauce thickens, 3 to 5 minutes. Set an oven rack about 6 inches from the heat source and preheat the oven's broiler to high. Cook chicken under the preheated broiler until skin is crispy, 6 to 8 minutes. Transfer chicken to a serving plate and spoon sauce over the top. Garnish with scallions. I Made It Print 43 home cooks made it! Add Your Photo Photos of Instant Pot Filipino Chicken Adobo 01 of 11 Photo by  Allrecipes Member 02 of 11 Photo by  fgodghlmpx 04/19/2024 03 of 11 Photo by  Shawn 03/26/2024 A keeper! Great flavors Easy to follow Family favorite Worth the effort Always good.From the Shawn's Best Cooking I used boneless instead of bone in 04 of 11 Photo by  brown medical taxi 05/15/2021 05 of 11 Photo by  Jake Genrich 02/12/2021 really good! will make again! 06 of 11 Photo by  buddog3033 06/09/2020 07 of 11 Photo by  janie 05/31/2020 This was a great, easy recipe. I will leave out the brown sugar last time as it didn’t need it. The broiling is great but if you put the sauce right over the chicken it doesn’t stay crispy so next time i will put down rice, pour broth, then place chicken on top. 08 of 11 Photo by  Jovie Orr 05/08/2020 OMG!! So good and reminds me of my dad's chicken adobo! Thank you for the recipe. It's delicious and perfect! My picky husband and daughter LOVE it too! 09 of 11 Photo by  MrsZomok 03/03/2020 1 2 Next You’ll Also Love Slow Cooker Filipino Chicken Adobo 17 Ratings Instant Pot® Ginataang Salmon (Filipino Salmon in Coconut Milk) 11 Ratings Authentic Chicken Adobo 20 Ratings Slow Cooker Adobo Chicken with Bok Choy 206 Ratings Famous Chicken Adobo 364 Ratings Lolah's Chicken Adobo 65 Ratings Pinoy Chicken Adobo 38 Ratings Pork and Chicken Adobo 9 Ratings Filipino Chicken Adobo 2 Ratings Guinataan Chicken Adobo 36 Ratings Slow Cooker Chicken Afritad 40 Ratings Chicken Tinola 101 Ratings Chicken Salpicao 1 Rating Instant Pot Garlic-Sesame Chicken Thighs 16 Ratings Instant Pot® Butter Chicken from Frozen 4 Ratings Lumpia in the Air Fryer 7 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: Soup Loving Nicole
instructions: Whisk together vinegar, soy sauce, garlic, olive oil, brown sugar, and crushed peppercorns in a medium bowl until sugar is dissolved. Stir in bay leaves.;Line the bottom of a multi-functional pressure cooker (such as Instant Pot) with onion slices. Place chicken thighs over onion and pour vinegar mixture over the top. Close and lock the lid.;Select high pressure according to manufacturer's instructions; set the timer for 10 minutes. Allow 10 minutes for pressure to build.;Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil.;Release pressure using the quick-release method according to manufacturer's instructions, about 5 minutes. Unlock and remove the lid. Using tongs, transfer chicken thighs to the prepared baking sheet, skin-side up. Select Sauté function and cook until sauce thickens, 3 to 5 minutes.;Set an oven rack about 6 inches from the heat source and preheat the oven's broiler to high.;Cook chicken under the preheated broiler until skin is crispy, 6 to 8 minutes. Transfer chicken to a serving plate and spoon sauce over the top. Garnish with scallions.
